headline: 'The Big Letdown For Me Is That We Trusted Them,' Publishers Clearing House's Bankruptcy Changes Winners' Fortunes Once Again
summary: For more than six decades, Publishers Clearing House showed up on doorsteps and slid into mailboxes with sweepstakes prize money that changed the lives of thousands of Americans. Oftentimes, those prizes guaranteed that money would continue coming for the rest of the winners' lives. Now, that may all be changing. headline: AI Is Disrupting Entry-Level Jobs, Stanford Study Reveals — Here's What You Need to Know
summary: Early-career workers in professions that are most exposed to generative AI are experiencing significant employment declines, while older workers and those in less-exposed fields remain relatively unaffected, according to a recent Stanford University study. About the Study Generative AI caused a 13% relative decline in hiring for early-career workers ages 22–25, particularly in highly AI-exposed professions like software engineering, according to the study. headline: Will New US Rules on Venezuelan Oil Exports Reshape Chevron's (CVX) Investment Narrative?
summary: In recent weeks, Chevron has been affected by new U.S. Treasury Department rules requiring it to pay Venezuelan royalties and taxes with oil, effectively limiting its Venezuelan exports to just half of joint venture production capacity. This development not only restricts the flow of heavy Venezuelan crude to the U.S., but also presents operational and financial challenges for Chevron, especially around debt repayments linked to its Venezuela operations. We’ll examine how the abrupt halving...

headline: Volkswagen (XTRA:VOW3) Is Down 6.8% After Temporary EV Plant Closures and Delayed Launches – What's Changed
summary: Earlier this month, Volkswagen AG announced temporary shutdowns at two of its German electric vehicle plants and delayed key EV launches, citing weaker demand, increased competition, and higher U.S. tariffs. This move, alongside a lowered profit outlook and ongoing trade headwinds, highlights the significant operational and regulatory pressures currently facing Europe's largest automaker. We'll examine how Volkswagen's temporary EV plant closures amid weak demand and higher tariffs shape...

headline: 'Open A Roth IRA And Fund It With Just $1': Suze Orman Explains Why The 5-Year Clock Matters So Much
summary: Financial expert Suze Orman is urging Americans not to wait when it comes to opening a Roth IRA. Even if you only have a single dollar to contribute, she says in a recent episode of her "Women & Money" podcast, getting an account started now can save you from future tax headaches. The reason comes down to the "five-year rule," a little-understood rule that determines when your Roth IRA money can truly be withdrawn tax-free. Why Roth IRAs Are So Valuable A Roth IRA is funded with after-tax dollar

headline: Will Engine Capital's Push for Reform Transform Acadia Healthcare's Strategic Path Forward (ACHC)?
summary: In September 2025, activist investor Engine Capital publicly urged Acadia Healthcare's board to implement substantial governance and operational changes, including a board refresh, cost cuts, a review of growth investments, and potential asset sales after disclosing a roughly 3% stake in the company. This move followed Engine Capital's concerns that Acadia had underperformed industry peers due to execution challenges, rising overheads, and management turnover despite maintaining a strong...

headline: Electronic Arts Nears Takeover by Silver Lake, PIF
summary: A takeover of Electronic Arts would rank among the biggest deals announced so far in 2025 and potentially the largest leveraged buyout of all time, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.  Shares of Redwood City, California-based Electronic Arts closed about 15% higher at $193.35 at in New York, giving the company a market value of roughly $48 billion.

headline: A Husband Stopped Sharing His Business Ideas With His Wife After Many Failed Attempts: 'You Have Sold Her A False Dream Too Many Times'
summary: Being an entrepreneur is hard, but it can be more difficult if a spouse is cautious about future projects. A husband recently told Reddit that he doesn't talk with his wife about business projects anymore because she said that "we know none of them work." While it sounds harsh, some people in the comments agreed with the wife's stance and understood where she was coming from. The husband has launched more than 10 business projects that all went bust.
